modules.description: Provides functions to create and render textures from image data using a GLFW window. Operates on image types with RGB or RGBA color formats and GLFW window handles. Used to initialize textures for rendering and to display images directly on a window surface.

Creates and manages graphical windows with custom data, supporting image rendering, event handling, and state manipulation. Operates on window objects that encapsulate GLFW windows and associated images, with support for RGB and RGBA formats. Used to display dynamic visuals, track user input, and update window content in real time.

Provides functions for loading, saving, and manipulating images using bigarrays as the underlying storage mechanism. Includes operations for pixel-wise transformations, color space conversions, and basic image filtering. Used to process raw image data in applications such as computer vision pipelines and graphical user interfaces.

Manages window creation and image rendering with GLFW, handling RGB and RGBA image data through texture initialization and real-time display. Supports event-driven updates and state changes via window objects that encapsulate GLFW resources. Allows for dynamic visual output by binding images to window surfaces and responding to user input. Enables rendering of static images or animated scenes with direct control over window content and interaction.
